def: A financial reward paid for each share owned to shareholders
The person who owns the business
People paid by the business to complete work
Businesses that provide other businesses with goods or services
People that live in the area near the business
When two sides discuss what they want and try to reach an agreement
Where people can take action to show they are unhappy with the business. Customers could do this by stopping buying the products and employees could go on strike
Local councils could refuse planning permission to expand a factory or employees could resist any changes if they do not like how the business is behaving
